solution_line_template: Jerry took {solution_L1_multiplier_typo}*{time_painting_house} = <<{solution_L1_multiplier_typo}*{time_painting_house}={time_kitchen_counter}>>{time_kitchen_counter} hours fixing the broken kitchen counter

Together, painting the house and fixing the broken kitchen counter took him {time_kitchen_counter}+{time_painting_house} = <<{time_kitchen_counter}+{time_painting_house}={time_painting_and_counter}>>{time_painting_and_counter} hours.

If he also took {time_mowing_lawn} hours mowing the lawn, the total time he spent working for Miss Stevie is {time_painting_and_counter}+{time_mowing_lawn} = <<{time_painting_and_counter}+{time_mowing_lawn}={total_work_time}>>{total_work_time}
Since he charged ${hourly_rate} per hour of work, he was paid {total_work_time}*${hourly_rate} = $<<{total_work_time}*{hourly_rate}={total_payment}>>{total_payment}
